name: Curried Chile Crab
author: yuan8808
summary: Fresh crab is stir-fried with garlic, ginger, and plenty of fresh chiles, then combined with curry powder and coconut milk for lots of flavor. Smallish crabs such as blue swimmers are good for this but you can use any fresh crabs you find at the market.
directions: Place crabs in a bowl and drizzle rice wine on top
Heat oil in a wok over medium-high heat
Cook and stir crabs until coated with oil, 2 to 3 minutes
Add garlic and ginger; cook and stir until fragrant, about 2 minutes
Stir in red bell pepper and red chile peppers; cook until slightly softened, about 1 minute
Pour coconut milk into the wok; add curry powder
Mix water and cornstarch in a small bowl until cornstarch is dissolved; stir into the wok
Cook and stir until sauce thickens, about 5 minutes
